Actually, Deemos did both insure a victory for the Chosen Ones and 
make the Predacons cease fire, but that's beside the point. Chordate 
is KSL's char and its perfectly legal to kidnap characters, 
espeacially one's own, whatever the motives or goals.




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "SOULSTICE" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: Whoa, there! I was just going with my own storylines, I wasn't 
trying
> to make everyone cease fire or anything like that. Technosis wasn't
> important to anyone, I thought, but Chordate is such a powerful 
figure, that
> it's easy to cause havoc by doing something like that. Understand 
now?
> Deemos taking Technosis captive didn't insure a victory for the 
CHosen Ones,
> he just wanted to leave there with Technosis, no problem. If the 
Alliance
> left with Chordate, would there be a problem with that? If so, then 
we have
> the hostage crisis all over again, except that unitron will 
probably fool
> everyone into going to the Alliance base and stuff to kill them 
all. And if
> there wouldn't be a problem. Well, Chordate will die. Tarantopulous 
isn't
> about to give up something he believes in, so he keeps firing. 
CHordate
> means nothing to him. You see?...
>
